title: V1 Curve Pool Tax Problem and Remediation
body:
We have discovered an important issue with the Curve V1 pool that needs to be resolved ASAP before the staking rewards contract ends.

The originally implemented tax system removed a portion of MIC2 from sale transactions resulting in more than 400K of MIC2 being sent to the boardroom and stabilization fund.

However, Curve pools do not recognize transfer taxes/fees, and so the pool still thinks that those 400K MIC2 are part of the available liquidity.

This means the pool printed more LP tokens than actual liquidity available, so if a user has more LP than liquidity available he can't withdraw from the pool.

After talking with Curve, there's a chance to fix this issue by sending the MIC2 that we collected from the previous tax system back to the pool.

We have close to 200K MIC2 in the stabilization fund, and are left with no choice but to buy the remainder from the current V2 pool, since the balance was already distributed to MIS stakers.

### This means an expense of $88K from the MDF at the current price of MIC2.

We currently have more than $140K in MDF, so while it's a big expense, we will be able to sustain operations going forward. SUSHI will continue to flow in as long as we remain on ONSEN.

As community leaders, we unanimously believe that making our LPs whole is essential if the project is to survive.

Since the MDF belongs to the community, we will hold an vote on this.

Note: The tax system in question is the one originally implemented by the core team. Our community dev team has since solved the issue with our new current tax system, and so removing liquidity from the V2 pool is working as intended.
choices: Use MDF to make LPs whole
